President Carter selected an FBI director and closed the government in 1980, while President Bush designated a public international organization and delegated disaster relief functions. During presidential transitions, executive orders play a significant role in reorganizing agencies and establishing policies. President Reagan transferred relief and emergency assistance functions to the director of FEMA, while President Carter issued executive orders related to the release of American hostages in Iran.
